userreviews.userReview: This is an excellent book about the time that Elissa Bjeletich was stuck in the hospital with her dying child, Mariana Bjeletich, who was not even a year old. Join them as they struggle through a liver transplant and the many ups and downs that followed. This story is incredibly inspiring and Elissa is exceelent when it comes to both word choice and showing the author's voice. I recomemnd this book to every one and anyone!

What a treasure! Elissa D. Bjeletich shares her experience as her daughter is diagnosed with liver disease. I was encouraged by her faith and attitude throughout the book. Don't be afraid to read this (especially if you tend to shy away from sad stories)--this isn't a sad story. It is real and there are both disappointments and triumphs. She writes, "It isn't easy to adapt to your child's decline…but it is certainly easier to adapt peacefully than to allow anger and depression to overtake your heart." I highly recommend this book for yourself or as a gift for anyone you love. This book is delightful! It will leave you smiling!
I like this book so much! :)

I "know" the author from Facebook and have heard bits and pieces of the story of her daughter's liver transplant. A publishing of her blog posts from this difficult time, this beautiful story shows great love, great faith, and great joy.

This is a gem of a book. I was so moved by this courageous mom's journey through such a terrifying time with her critically ill baby. While the medical journey is itself quite the tale, it was the author's steadfast Orthodox faith that I was so struck by and inspired by in so many ways. I think that any Orthodox Christian would be deeply moved by this book and will find much within the pages. Any reader, whether Orthodox or not, would find this a compelling tale of one parent's journey through an unspeakable time with faith and love. Highly recommend.

Following the journey of the author as she supported and cheered and sacrificed her own plans, her own needs to tend to and support her failing newborn. The story is about moving from sickness to health, aided by the many miracles both prayer and modern medicine can bring... Though I've never endured this sort of struggle in my own life, I feel like I've walked this road by way of the book, and have new tools of endurance from the author's example to help aid me if I ever end up in a similar place. A lovely and encouraging read...
Amazing - even the title is powerful. An amazing journey of hope, fear, and religion.
I have never been in the position that Elissa found herself in. However, if I ever was put in that position, I would hope that I would handle it with the same grace, strength and faith as Elissa.

description: Popular AFR podcaster Elissa Bjeletich ("Raising Saints") faced every parent's nightmare: After losing a child to SIDS, she gave birth to a daughter with severe liver disease. In God's Hands chronicles Elissa's journey with baby Mariana from critical illness through a liver transplant and ultimately to health. Along the way, Elissa struggled with doubt, fear, and impatience, but ultimately her faith in God and her love for her family carried her through. Her journey will comfort and inspire you as you face whatever struggles life puts in your way.
title: In God's Hands:  A mother's journey through her infant's critical illness
